revised_title: Discontinuous Variation in Biscutella laevigata: Exploring Leaf Surface Characteristics
tldr: The author investigates the variation in leaf surface characteristics of Biscutella laevigata, a cruciferous plant found in alpine regions. They observe two distinct forms, one hairy and the other glabrous, and discuss the factors that may contribute to the maintenance of these distinct forms despite potential intercrossing.
